author: , Pensacola News Journal
title: Can Florida see northern lights on Friday? Here's how to see them
text: Chances are pretty good that if you spent anytime online today you saw people posting photos of the northern lights in places they normally aren’t seen. If you feel like you missed out, you’re not alone, but you may still be in luck. There’s a small chance that you’ll be able to catch another glimpse of the aurora borealis, also known as the https://www.tallahassee.com/story/news/2024/10/10/northern-lights-in-florida-theres-a-chance-tonight/75615036007/, again tonight, but it probably won’t be as simple as just looking up at the sky for Floridians . Just like the last time Florida was able to see the https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2024/10/10/where-to-see-northern-lights-thursday-solar-storm/75604973007/, back on May 10, the light’s pink and green hues are basically invisible to the naked eye. To really get a good look at it, you’ll need to break out your phone’s camera and let it do the work for you – preferably through the magic of long-exposure photography. Here’s how you might be able to see the northern lights in Florida tonight . Will you be able to see the northern lights tonight in Florida? A geomagnetic storm, which is what causes the northern lights, is forecast to happen again Friday night, but it’s a bit weaker than Thursday’s. That means there is a chance to catch the lights once it gets dark. The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration has issued a (G3) geomagnetic storm watch for Friday night thanks to something called a coronal mass ejection (CME). That’s a fancy way of saying that there was a massive expulsion of plasma and magnetic fields from the Sun’s corona, which is the outermost part of its atmosphere. The too-long, didn’t-read version of the story is that CMEs can create geomagnetic storms. This particular level is relatively strong, which is why the northern lights are appearing in odd spots of the globe. NOAA says that watches of this level are infrequent but not uncommon. What time will you be able to see the northern lights tonight? “Unfortunately, predicting the timing of auroras is much harder than predicting the weather,” the National Weather Service Tallahassee office wrote on Twitter, which didn’t stop NOAA from attempting to do so anyway. The CME effects began at approximately 11:15 p.m. EDT on Thursday, and they are expected to continue through Friday. The best time to look for the northern lights is when its darkest, which is typically around midnight. In Florida, astronomical twilight will occur around 8:18 p.m. EDT and midnight will be around 12:12 a.m. What’s the best way to see the northern lights? Seeing the northern lights takes a bit of effort and a bit of luck. Time and your location are probably the biggest factors in whether or not you’ll see the northern lights, and the reason is the same for both: light pollution. You’ll want to go out and look for the northern lights when its darkest and you’ll want to be in a location away from a lot of light pollution. Looking for the lights with just your eyes is also likely going to be a lost cause in Florida because the auroras will be faint. Instead, grab your camera and snap some photos. Your camera is much more sensitive to light than your eyes are, so it has a better chance of capturing those auroras. If you’re not having any luck with your phone, try adjusting your camera to a lower shutter speed, if possible. You’ll want to grab a tripod or something sturdy you can set your phone on to keep it stable. The longer your camera’s aperture is open, the more light it’s able to capture. Why can’t I see the northern lights? The easy answer is that science is complicated. While it’s true that CMEs can create geomagnetic storms, the truth is that there are several more factors that come into play, such as the Kp index. Thursday’s storm had a Kp index of 8, which meant that the auroras moved even further toward the equator and were very bright and active. Your location also plays a huge factor into whether you’ll see the northern lights. You’ll want to make sure you’re in a spot that doesn’t have a lot of light pollution that could interfere with the lights. Unfortunately, there is no guarantee that you’ll see the northern lights even if you do everything right. Northern lights can arrive in pulses, which means they may be visible for periods ranging from an hour to just 15 minutes, reappearing sporadically throughout the night. Lastly, it’s entirely possible that Friday’s storm won’t be strong enough to reach your exact location. The further south you are, the more difficult it will be to spot the northern lights. Contributor: Eric Lagatta - USA Today.

author: Taylor Brokesh
title: Portsmouth man gets 10 years for fentanyl trafficking | 13newsnow.com
text: PORTSMOUTH, Va. — A Portsmouth man was sentenced Tuesday to 10 years in federal prison for trafficking fentanyl. This sentence is not his first drug trafficking conviction. According to court documents, Karleak Ali, 53, sold fentanyl and cocaine to undercover Chesapeake Police officers during five controlled buys between February and May 2023. On May 25, 2023, officers from Chesapeake Police and the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives (ATF) executed a search warrant at Ali’s residence and vehicle, seizing 33 grams of fentanyl, 87 grams of cocaine, packaging materials, drug paraphernalia, two firearms, ammunition, and approximately $6,000. Ali has prior felony drug convictions in Norfolk Circuit Court for cocaine distribution. He was also convicted in federal court in 2007 for conspiracy to distribute and possess with intent to distribute cocaine.
topics: Crime, Law and Justice->prosecution and prosecutors
Crime, Law and Justice->drug related crimes

author: kentoncopland4
title: Sleep Higher: The Cooling Benefits of a White Eucalyptus Comforter
text:
Sleep performs an essential position in our general well-being, influencing everything from our temper to our immune system. But, for a lot of, falling and staying asleep could be a nightly challenge. Factors like room temperature, bedding materials, and comfort can all impact sleep quality. A white eucalyptus comforter, in particular, is gaining popularity as a perfect alternative for a cooler, more comfortable evening’s sleep. This eco-friendly, temperature-regulating bedding has shown potential in enhancing sleep quality by keeping the body cool throughout the night. Right here’s why a white eucalyptus comforter could be the lacking piece in your pursuit of a great night’s rest.
1. Natural Temperature Regulation
One of the standout features of eucalyptus-derived bedding is its ability to regulate temperature naturally. Unlike traditional comforters made from cotton or down, eucalyptus comforters are crafted from eucalyptus fibers (often Tencel Lyocell) which might be naturally breathable and moisture-wicking. The eucalyptus fibers permit air to flow into more freely and absorb moisture from the body, helping it evaporate more efficiently. In consequence, these comforters maintain a comfortable sleeping temperature, making them a really perfect selection for anyone who tends to overheat at night. The gentle cooling impact provided by eucalyptus comforters could be particularly helpful for those dwelling in warmer climates or during summer season months when nighttime temperatures can spike.
2. Soft and Luxurious Comfort
Another interesting side of a white eucalyptus comforter is its soft, silky texture. Eucalyptus fibers are known for their smooth, nearly satin-like really feel, which makes them exceptionally comfortable in opposition to the skin. Unlike other cooling supplies which will feel artificial or rough, eucalyptus provides a softness that’s closer to high-quality cotton or silk. This smoothness provides a sense of luxury that may elevate your sleep expertise, making it simpler to chill out and settle into bed. Moreover, eucalyptus fibers have hypoallergenic properties, making this comforter a great selection for individuals with sensitive skin or allergies. You possibly can enjoy a restful sleep without worrying about skin irritation or allergic reactions.
3. Sustainable and Eco-Friendly
The benefits of a white eucalyptus comforter extend beyond personal comfort; additionally they have a positive impact on the environment. Eucalyptus fibers are sourced from fast-rising eucalyptus trees, which require less water, pesticides, and fertilizers compared to different textile crops like cotton. Eucalyptus production typically uses closed-loop systems that recycle water and solvents, making the process more sustainable and eco-friendly. For consumers who prioritize environmental responsibility, eucalyptus comforters are a wonderful choice. The choice of white for a eucalyptus comforter additional underscores its minimalism and eco-conscious appeal, as white is often related with cleanliness and simplicity.
4. Enhanced Durability and Easy Maintenance
Unlike some other luxurious supplies, eucalyptus fibers are surprisingly durable and resilient. They hold up well to regular use, that means your comforter can maintain its shape and comfort level over time without excessive pilling or fraying. Additionally, many eucalyptus comforters are designed to be machine washable, making them easy to care for and maintain. Regular washing doesn’t impact the fabric’s cooling properties, which means you may enjoy a clean, fresh, and cool sleep environment without any hassle. The durability and low-maintenance nature of eucalyptus comforters make them a worthwhile investment for those seeking long-term comfort.
5. Promotes a Cool and Calming Aesthetic
There’s something inherently calming a few white eucalyptus comforter. The impartial, clean look of white bedding can create a serene atmosphere, helping to reduce visual clutter and promote relaxation. White can even make a room seem larger and more open, which can contribute to a sense of peace and calm, aiding in a greater sleep environment. By opting for white bedding, you’ll be able to create a sanctuary-like really feel in your bedroom that aligns with the cool, refreshing qualities of eucalyptus fibers.
6. Helps Higher Sleep Quality
Ultimately, the cooling benefits of a white eucalyptus comforter contribute to higher sleep quality. The human body’s temperature naturally drops throughout sleep, and sustaining a cooler environment may also help signal the body that it’s time to rest. Eucalyptus comforters align with this natural cooling process, enabling you to go to sleep faster and enjoy deeper, uninterrupted sleep. People who struggle with night time sweats or who wake up steadily because of feeling hot can discover reduction with eucalyptus bedding, which works to wick away moisture and prevent overheating.
Conclusion
Should you’ve been seeking a way to improve your sleep, a white eucalyptus comforter would be the resolution you’re looking for. From its natural temperature-regulating properties to its sustainable and hypoallergenic enchantment, eucalyptus bedding offers a range of benefits that may transform your nightly experience. By staying cool and comfortable, you’ll not only sleep higher but in addition wake up feeling more refreshed and ready to take on the day. The cooling benefits, mixed with the luxurious softness and eco-friendly credentials, make a white eucalyptus comforter a valuable addition to any bedroom for these looking to enhance their sleep and environmental footprint alike.

author: Karl Cooke
title: Rain and snow making presence felt in Central Valley
text:
FRESNO, Calif. (FOX26) — Thursday morning was a rainy day across the city of Fresno.
In the Southeast area, roads started to fill up with water. forcing drivers to be more cautious on the road.
Some roads even had some slight flooding, which caused more cautions for drivers. Some water was so high that they almost covered clothing on the roads.
In the foothills of the central valley, snow hit the areas hard.
A video from China Peak shows the slopes getting some extra snow for people who want to ski or snowboard.
Other angles, like from the boathouse camera near Huntington Lake, shows how the snow impacted spots close to the lake.
The snow was so packed that tire chains were needed for anyone driving in the area.
Other spots like Shaver Lake were hit just as hard. webcams from Kan’s Liquor show the snow building up on cars that were both parked and even driving.
In Yosemite, it was the same as the rest.
Footage from the Yosemite Conservancy shows a blanket of snow covering the ground and the trees.
A first day of possibly more weather impacts to come.

author: @ChristianPost
title: La congregación detiene los planes para destruir la histórica iglesia de Nueva York después de que celebridades se opusieran | TheChristianPostSpanish
text: La congregación detiene los planes para destruir la histórica iglesia de Nueva York después de que celebridades se opusieran Según los informes, los planes para demoler la histórica Iglesia Presbiteriana de West Park en Manhattan, Nueva York, debido a sus dificultades financieras, se han detenido tras las objeciones de residentes locales y celebridades, incluidos Matt Damon y Mark Ruffalo. La iglesia de 133 años tenía la intención de vender la propiedad para convertirla en apartamentos de lujo. Sin embargo, el estatus de monumento del edificio, otorgado en 2010, requirió la aprobación de la Comisión de Preservación de Monumentos Históricos de la ciudad para su demolición, [según](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/01/05/nyregion/west-park-presbyterian-church-celebrities-demolition.html) The New York Times, que dijo que la solicitud de permiso de la iglesia, realizada en 2022, generó un apoyo generalizado para la preservación del edificio, incluido de los actores Damon y Ruffalo. La congregación retiró su solicitud, influenciada por una demanda contra un inquilino por una disputa de arrendamiento, días antes de que la comisión votara sobre la solicitud de la iglesia el martes, dijo el Times. Sin embargo, la iglesia planea volver a presentar la solicitud en el futuro. La congregación dijo en un comunicado que resuelven “volver a presentar nuestra solicitud a la LPC cuando se resuelva el litigio para que finalmente podamos invertir en el espacio comunitario y de culto moderno y accesible que el Upper West Side merece y apoyar aún más nuestra misión en nuestro vecindario y en toda la ciudad de Nueva York”, [citado](https://www.westsiderag.com/2024/01/05/west-park-presbyterian-church-withdraws-hardship-application-its-over) por West Side Rag. Los líderes de la iglesia firmaron un contrato vinculante en 2022 con el desarrollador del condominio debido a una factura de reparación de $2 millones que no podían pagar. También presentaron una [solicitud por dificultades económicas](https://www.centeratwestpark.org/save-west-park) buscando quitarle el lugar emblemático y demoler el edificio para dar paso al condominio, que también incluiría espacio de culto para la iglesia. Gale Brewer, miembro del concejo municipal que representa al Upper West Side, expresó su esperanza de que el retraso pueda conducir a la preservación del edificio. En medio de la crisis inmobiliaria de la ciudad de Nueva York, algunos argumentan que la oposición a la demolición de la iglesia obstaculiza el desarrollo de viviendas muy necesarias. “Como anciano de la iglesia y miembro fundador del Centro en West Park, también estoy frustrado por la difícil posición en la que nos encontramos hoy”, dijo Marsha Flowers, anciana gobernante de la Iglesia Presbiteriana de West Park y miembro fundador de la junta. del Centro en West Park, dijo en un comunicado a [The Christian Post](https://www.christianpost.com/news/actor-matt-damon-joins-fight-to-save-historic-nyc-church.html) en ese momento. “Ayudamos a crear el Centro en 2017 para celebrar las artes mientras recaudamos fondos para las reparaciones del edificio, pero los fondos nunca llegaron a pesar de más de una década de promesas y compromisos de los líderes locales”, agregó Flowers. "Nuestra congregación ahora se centra en crear un nuevo espacio para el culto y las artes, y esperamos utilizar nuestras ganancias para ayudar a otras iglesias a cumplir su misión y evitar circunstancias como la nuestra". En un esfuerzo por apoyar la preservación del edificio, el actor Matt Damon [participó](https://www.christianpost.com/news/actor-matt-damon-joins-fight-to-save-historic-nyc-church.html) en una obra de teatro en la iglesia en noviembre pasado. Wendell Pierce; La comediante Amy Schumer, así como el rapero y actor Common también han aportado su poder estelar al esfuerzo para salvar el edificio.

author: Mark Johnson,Trent Magill,Katie McGraw,Phil Sakal
title: Snow Ending for you Friday & warming this weekend!
text:
CLEVELAND — ALERTS:
- Ashtabula County: Lake Effect Snow Warning through 7 am Friday.
- Lake County: Winter Weather Advisory through 7 am Friday.
Lake-effect snow squalls will continue across NEO until early Friday. Elsewhere, a few flurries and cold sunshine can be expected. High temperatures will struggle all day. Temps will climb into the mid and upper 20s, but with lighter winds, it will not feel nearly as cold as Thursday. Tonight will be clear, calm, and cold with lows in the teens.
The cold will not last long. Temperatures will begin to climb by the weekend. Highs will be back in the 40s - which is more seasonable for December. Much of Saturday will be dry, with increasing clouds by Saturday evening. The next system will arrive by Saturday night and will continue until Sunday. A wintry mix will be possible during the onset of precipitation.
The highest/most widespread chance for rain looks to be early on Sunday, with some breaks for the second half of the day. and there will be more rain chances late on Saturday and into Sunday. If you are going to the Browns Game - plan for rain!
DAILY FORECAST:
Friday: Partly sunny. Snow early with a few flurries later. Not as cold or windy. | High: 27º
Saturday: More clouds. Milder. Rain late. | High: 42º
Sunday: Rain likely, especially first half of the day.| High: 44º
Monday: More rain. | High: 52º
Tuesday: Wintry mix possible.| High: 42º
